intro: Lewisia columbiana var. wallowensis, commonly known as the Wallowa lewisia, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of the United States. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, violet-blue flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. It is often found in alpine meadows and is known for its resilience to cold and arid conditions. This variety is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in rock gardens.
